snippet: George T. McDonald, a Republican mayoral candidate, said that the city’s laws disadvantaged first-time candidates without a longtime base of supporters or a personal fortune.
abstract: Justice Kathryn E Freed rebuffs attempt by George T McDonald, a first-time Republican mayoral candidate, to overturn New York City’s strict limits on campaign contributions, ruling that city has right to try to reduce influence of money in politics.
lead_paragraph: George T. McDonald, a Republican mayoral candidate, said that the city’s laws disadvantaged first-time candidates without a longtime base of supporters or a personal fortune.

headline.seo: Judge Upholds New York’s Campaign Contribution Limits
headline.main: Strict Limits on Giving in City Races Are Upheld
headline.print_headline: Strict Limits On Giving In City Races Are Upheld
